TopicTitle: Looking for ideas for something to model

Articles.Content: I haven't done any 3d modeling in a while and decided that the best way to get back into it would be to try modelling something for KSP. I am looking for something to model that is preferably real, although exceptions may be made, and preferably either does not have a mod or at least not one being maintained. Not sure if this belongs in general or development, but I put it here since it is sort of a reverse request.

THE KRAKEN!!!

(literally a kraken ship which you can fly)

Or something more mundane: a truck like the ones around KSC.

A "preferably white" aerodynamic adapter that splits 1 of the largest tanks into 3 of the largest tanks.. For us FAR users. ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif) .. Yeah, we can just increase the size of a stock one, but they arent very sleak/aerodynamic.. lol

**Edited <time datetime="2015-03-26T23:30:10Z" title="03/26/2015 11:30  PM" data-short="9 yr">March 26, 2015</time> by Talavar**

> THE KRAKEN!!!
> (literally a kraken ship which you can fly)
> 
> Or something more mundane: a truck like the ones around KSC.

I'm not really interested in doing the Kraken and Helldiver's KSO mod already has some very good ground vehicles: [http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/68429-0-90-Kerbin-Shuttle-Orbiter-System-v4-13](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/68429-0-90-Kerbin-Shuttle-Orbiter-System-v4-13)

- - - Updated - - -

> 
> A "preferably white" aerodynamic adapter that splits 1 of the largest tanks into 3 of the largest tanks.. For us FAR users. ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif) .. Yeah, we can just increase the size of a stock one, but they arent very aerodynamic.. lol

I might make try my hand at that but, you could make one with procedural parts with a cone shaped tank/structural piece and the procedural adapter that would be more versatile.

 Good stuff! Look forward to crashi.. uh flying with it.. ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif) lol

> 
> Good stuff! Look forward to crashi.. uh flying with it.. ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif) lol

Just to clarify, you want a tri-coupler that is longer so that it is sleeker and more aerodynamic.

Here's a first attempt: 

> [Javascript is disabled. View full album](//imgur.com/a/pkr8q)

The top is 3.75m in diameter, the bottom is 8.25m, and the total height is 3m with 0.25m of cylinder on the top and the bottom. Just tell me what you would want changed.
